Shattering peoples wishes, one century at a time.

I’m dying of cancer and, clearly, I’m a miserable SOB. I just want to die peacefully in my sleep. Alone. And my remains to be disposed with at earliest convenience, with as little fuss as possible and as little disturbance to earth as possible; no embalming with toxic poisons that leech into the soil. No cremation that uses up so much energy and waste. No expensive casket, flowers and other wasted materials. And most especially, no family or friends eating money and carbon emissions, flying from all over the world, merely to dispose of my corpse and have a ridiculous funeral I don’t want.

But are funerals for the dead or the living? I think they’re selfish and useless popularity contest for the living. And should abolish this wasteful ‘tradition’. Most traditions should die quickly…

Anyway, I’m sick. There is no cure. I’m suffering. Pain killers aren’t enough. I’ve lived a miserable life because I’ve been sick for so long, I’ve forgotten how to be happy. How to be kind to people I used to love. There’s nobody left anymore and I just want to depart already.

I don’t want to be remembered. There’s nothing worth remembering anymore. The countless surgeries and horrific treatments that have converted me into a bitter, resentful, cynical bastard? Just let me go. Burn all my photographs. Erase my social media accounts.
Don’t resurrect me.

Michael, understand that some people truly want to be left alone and you can’t comprehend that…
